title: Natalie Portman says she is now 'sharing salary details' with other actresses in Hollywood
text:
Natalie Portman is talking to other female stars about their salaries.

It used to be taboo in the industry, but the 38-year-old Professional star told the November Women In Hollywood issue of ELLE magazine it helps to be in the know so actresses can all get paid better.

'If we don't talk to each other, we can't share, we can't get information, we can't get angry and organize together,' the Star Wars vet said. 'It's actually really important to talk.'

Making a difference: Natalie Portman is talking to other female stars about their salaries. It used to be taboo in the industry, but the 38-year-old Professional star told the November Women In Hollywood issue of ELLE magazine it helps to be in the know

'Something we've been talking about is sharing salary details with each other, because right now it's such a taboo,' Natalie added.

'It's actually a real way that we can help each other, to be like, "Hey, this is what I get paid. This is how I negotiated this."'

She also believes in speaking up when someone has wronged her.

Portman had an issue with Moby earlier this year when he said he had dated Natalie when he was 33, and she 20.

Talking her film: Portman and Jon Hamm chatting up Lucy In The Sky on Good Morning America on Thursday

The star has five projects in the works, including Dolphin Reef, What If...?, Thor: Love and Thunder, We Are All Completely Beside Ourselves, and Lucy in the Sky.

The latter, Lucy in the Sky, tells of a successful astronaut's downward spiral after committing an extramarital affair with a fellow astronaut, and ultimately attempting to kidnap the women he leaves her for.

The film is actually based on the real-life story of Lisa Nowak and her love triangle with astronaut William Oefelein and Air Force engineer, Colleen Shipman
